poem:
**Avianos: The Warring Dinosaurs**

An anthology of pixels—  
prehistoric battles  
in hues of neon green and sepia,

A fictive beat  
from a ghostly developer,  
UFO Soft scribes forgotten realms—

warring fossils  
under digital moons.  
Nostalgia's thumb  
presses through time.

Behind each signal,  
a child's breath,  
imagining.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pushing Buttons: UFO 50 is an anthology of pure nostalgia – and the games are good, too I filed this issue of Pushing Buttons late, because I have become obsessed with a 1985 strategy game about armies of warring dinosaurs. It’s called Avianos, and it’s part of an anthology of 50 games made in the 1980s by a little-known but influential developer, UFO Soft. One minor detail: UFO Soft is fictional. All the games in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
